title: Why do people keep saying that America is the land of opportunity?
self_text: I am not American and have never been to America, but every time I hear about it on TV or in the news they say it's "the land of opportunity". Is it actually like that? Or is it just propaganda?

title: If you had to live in a country where you have to speak the language of that country but they don't understand your native language, which country would you choose?
self_text: I like Europe and some countries in Asia.   I do not want to live in China or Russia though because I can already see myself being discriminated against.  I also am not a fan of Mexico.  So it has to be somewhere else besides those countries.

title: What is the deal with people who just want to get married?
self_text: Like, why do they even bother getting engaged and then wanting a wedding?

title: Why is it so hard to get a job at an airport?
self_text: I've been applying for months and not getting any interviews. Do you need some sort of special training or license to work at an airport?  I just want to be a food service worker, nothing high tech.

title: Why do some people have a hard time understanding the concept of "perspective"?
self_text: Like, it's not like I think everyone should agree with me, or that my opinion is always right. But sometimes I just want them to understand where I am coming from.  It feels like they don't even try to see things from my point of view. It's frustrating because it makes it feel like we are talking past each other and can never reach an agreement.  Is there something wrong with me? Or is it just their way of thinking?

title: Why do people put an ad for the same thing over and over again?
self_text: I see it all the time, usually on Facebook or Craigslist. They just keep reposting their ad, but if someone was interested in what they're selling, why wouldn't they have already contacted them? Is there a reason to do that?

title: What is the deal with people who love to hate on a specific group of people?
self_text: I'm not talking about hating people based on their personality or behavior, but rather something like "I hate everyone from [state/country]". Why do people do that? Is it just a way to feel superior? Or are they actually afraid of those people for some reason?  There's also a lot of hatred towards groups of people who share a common interest (e.g., furries, gamers). It seems so weird and pointless to me.

title: What does the phrase “the whole shebang” mean?
self_text: I’ve always thought it meant a whole lot of things, like everything that goes into something. But I recently heard someone say they were getting “the whole shebang” at an ice cream shop and I didn’t think that meant they were getting everything in the store! Is there another meaning to this phrase?  Maybe some regional usage?

title: Why do they call it "the real world" when there are so many different worlds in the universe?
self_text: Is that a metaphor for something else?

title: Why do I always get so angry when my boyfriend calls me a "silly goose"?
self_text: It's not even like he says it in a mean way, but I can never help getting mad when he does that and sometimes I end up yelling at him over something so dumb. Is there a reason why I feel so triggered by that phrase?

title: What's the best way to get over a break-up?
self_text: I've been with my boyfriend for about 3 years now, and we just broke up.  I can't stop thinking about him, and I don't know what to do. How do people move on from relationships?   Is it normal to feel like you're never going to be happy again?

title: Why is it that most people have a bad experience with the military?
self_text: I've heard so many stories of horrible experiences in the military, but why? I understand that some people like their time there, but what makes it such a negative experience for others?

title: Why is it called a “taco” if it’s not made with the shell?
self_text: I just ordered from my local Taco Bell and got tacos with no shells. That doesn’t make sense to me, why do they call them tacos then? It’s like calling an egg without the shell an egg…  I know it sounds dumb but it bugs me every time.

title: What is the most effective way to lose weight?
self_text: I want to lose around 10 pounds in two months.  I am willing to exercise and eat healthy, but what is the best combination of both that will yield results quickly?

title: How do you get your partner to stop texting other people when you're together?
self_text: My girlfriend is always texting her friends whenever we are hanging out with each other, and it makes me feel like she doesn't care about our time together. Is there a way I can talk to her about this without sounding controlling or jealous?

title: What is the deal with all these “dudebros” in the gym?
self_text: Why are they so obsessed with lifting weights and making themselves look good? I understand wanting to be healthy, but it seems like a lot of them are just trying to show off their muscles and impress other people. Is there something else going on here that I’m not understanding?

title: If you could ask a single question to an AI, what would it be?
self_text: I'm asking for help with my homework assignment. What are the most important things that people should know about AI in general?  I need some ideas to write down and start researching on. Thanks!

title: Why do people say that the world is becoming more "polarized" as if it's a bad thing?
self_text: I mean, you can look at any historical period and see plenty of conflict between different groups. It seems like the only difference now is we have social media so we just know about everything going on all over the place.

title: If you could have any superpower, what would it be?
self_text: I've thought about this a lot and I think the best superpower is being able to teleport anywhere in the world instantly. It would be so much fun! You could go on adventures whenever you wanted and never have to worry about travel time or cost. What do you think?  I was thinking of something like Doctor Strange. He can just open up portals to wherever he wants to go. That would be amazing.

title: Is it possible to have a baby with your cousin?
self_text: It's been discussed in my family before, and I think the answer is no. But I was wondering why it's not allowed?

title: Why is it okay to drink alcohol at age 21 but not weed?
self_text: I am a minor and am only asking for educational purposes.

title: Why do people like to ask questions that are already answered on the internet?
self_text: I'm really starting to get annoyed by this, because it feels like a lot of questions asked here and other places could just be solved with a quick google search.  I know that people have all kinds of reasons for asking questions instead of searching, but it still gets to me. It makes it seem like they're not even trying to solve their own problems. And it seems especially bad when it comes to things like homework questions or simple math problems.  I realize that there are some good reasons why someone might need to ask a question, such as if they've tried everything else and can't find an answer, or if they're looking for a more nuanced explanation than what they can find online. But in many cases, it just feels like laziness.  Am I being unreasonable?

title: What is a good way to deal with the “I’m just an empath” people?
self_text: I feel like people who say that they are empaths are really just trying to justify their nosy behavior and need for drama.  I can’t think of another explanation for it. It doesn’t seem very nice, but does anyone have any insight on why someone would behave that way?

title: Is it safe to put a metal object in the microwave?
self_text: I want to heat up my phone, but the only way is with the microwave. It's got an aluminum frame so it's probably not safe...right?

title: How do I find out how many calories something has?
self_text: So, I'm on a diet and i don't have time to weigh my food or look it up.  So I just kinda wing it with a rough estimate of what I think the calorie count is.  I feel like that can be off. Is there some sort of way to visually determine roughly how much something has in terms of calories?  Like, if I could get down to an art, would it make sense to eat less fat/carbs, etc.? Or am I being silly for even thinking about doing that?

title: Why do we need to sleep?
self_text: I was reading an article about how scientists still don't know why humans need to sleep, but it seems like there is a consensus that the brain needs to perform maintenance while asleep. But why can't our brains just maintain themselves while awake? Is it because of the energy cost or something else?

title: What’s the difference between a man and an adult?
self_text: I am a male so please no responses that say “man” is just what you call a boy when they grow up or anything like that.  I understand the biological difference but what’s the difference in personality, maturity, etc.?

title: What is the most common reason that a person would want to leave their job?
self_text: It’s not just about money. It can be any number of things, like having a bad boss or being bored with the work. But what do you think is the biggest reason people quit their jobs?

title: What's the best way to get a cat who doesn't like being held to start liking it?
self_text: I love cats, and my boyfriend has a cat that he got when he was in college. He said she didn't like being held then, and still doesn't like being held now. I've tried picking her up, but she runs away as soon as I go near her. Any advice on how to get her to trust me enough to let me hold her?

title: Is it illegal to use a fake ID when you're under the age of 21?
self_text: I'm just wondering if there are any laws that would prevent me from using a fake ID in order to purchase alcohol, even though I am not yet 21 years old.  I understand that it is against store policy and could get me banned from the establishment, but does it actually break any laws?

title: Can you ask a girl on Instagram for her number?
self_text: I have been talking to this girl on Instagram and we are getting along really well. But she doesn't seem to be very active on the app, so it is hard to communicate with her. She seems like a pretty chill person too. I was thinking of asking her for her phone number but I don't know if that would come off as weird or not. What do you guys think?  I'm not looking for anything sexual just want to get to know her better.

title: Do you think there will be a recession in 2023?
self_text: Why or why not?

title: Is it possible to take a trip to the moon on your own?
self_text: I'm talking about taking a rocket and just going there by yourself, without any help from anyone else.

title: Why do some people get motion sickness?
self_text: I'm just curious why some people can go on roller coasters and enjoy it, but others vomit everywhere when they walk into a car?

title: How does the concept of “I’m not racist but…” work?
self_text: It seems like every time someone says that, it is usually followed by something incredibly racist. But what if you are literally not a racist and genuinely want to know why people get offended when you ask them about their race/ethnicity? I am asking because I was recently called out for this on Reddit and am still confused as to why I would be considered racist.  So my question is, how do you avoid saying something racist after “I’m not racist but…?” Or better yet, should you just never say it at all?

title: How much does it cost to build a nuclear reactor?
self_text: I’m wondering how much it would take in today’s money to build a nuclear reactor from scratch, and if there are any materials that you can only get from certain countries.

title: What are some of the benefits of being a woman?
self_text: I'm not asking for sex, don't get your panties in a twist. Just curious about what it's like to be a female and how you feel about it.

title: How do you deal with the feeling of being a burden to others?
self_text: I'm getting tired of asking for help because I don't want to be perceived as someone who can't take care of themselves, even though that is very much the case.   I feel like I need to start doing things myself but it feels impossible at times, and I end up just falling into depression instead.  Do people really mind helping others or am I overthinking this?

title: How can I make a big mistake?
self_text: My friend told me that he’s making a big mistake with his life, so I wanted to try it too! What would you guys do?  I don’t know if I want to go into debt or get fired from my job or something like that. Any ideas?

title: Is it a sign of an overprotective parent if they won't let their kid go on a field trip to the zoo?
self_text: I feel like it is, but my mom always says "I don't want you to be in danger" and stuff.  It makes me think she has some kind of anxiety disorder or something.   She says the zoo isn't safe because there are wild animals.

title: What is the difference between a lawyer, barrister and solicitor?
self_text: I'm sorry if this has been asked before but I couldn't find any posts about it that explained it in terms a lay person could understand.

title: How do you get rid of a friend who won't stop asking for money?
self_text: He is always broke and will ask me for money whenever he gets the chance, and I don't want to be his ATM anymore but I don't know how to tell him without hurting his feelings or making things weird between us. What should I do?

title: Why do I have to pay a deposit when renting?
self_text: If you can’t afford the rent, how are you going to afford a deposit? It just seems like a pointless step.

title: Why is it that most men get taller until they are around 18 years of age but women stop growing much earlier?
self_text: Is there a reason why the growth plates in girls close at such an early age compared to boys?

title: What does it mean to be a “narcissist” in the context of relationships?
self_text: I've heard people call their partners "narcissists" when they are just being difficult, or trying to control the relationship... is there an actual medical diagnosis for that? Or is it just something people say about someone who doesn’t give them what they want?

title: Why do people like to use the phrase “as a matter of fact” before saying something that is obvious?
self_text: I always feel as if they’re being condescending when they say it, but I don’t think that’s their intention. Is there any reason for using it?

title: Why is it that a person who has no experience in something thinks they know more about the subject than someone with years of experience?
self_text: I've had several people, including family members and friends, tell me how to do my job when they have never worked at my workplace or even in my field before. It really bothers me because I feel like they don't respect what I do. Is there a psychological reason why some people act this way?

title: What is the purpose of a dog's nose?
self_text: I have always wondered what the purpose of a dog's nose is, but never really asked anyone about it. Why do they have them? What do they use them for?

title: Why do people with no sense of smell eat spicy food?
self_text: I have no sense of smell so I can't taste spices like chili and garlic as much, but that doesn't stop me from eating them. What stops you?  I've had many conversations about why people are afraid to try new foods.   Why does a lack of smell make it less desirable for someone?

title: Why does my phone always say that the apps I’m using are “optimizing”?
self_text: Like, it doesn’t matter if I am scrolling through Reddit or just watching a YouTube video. It says “Optimizing” at the top of the screen and then I can’t do anything for a few seconds. Is this normal? And what is it optimizing anyway?

title: How do I tell my dad that he is a bad driver?
self_text: My dad has been driving for over 50 years and his skills have definitely deteriorated with age. He drives too slow, gets easily distracted, can’t see well, etc. I don’t want to upset him but I also think it’s dangerous when he drives. What should I do?

title: How can I tell if a guy is being weird or just shy?
self_text: I've been talking to this guy for like a month now and he's really nice, but he gets quiet whenever I talk about myself and then he starts rambling when it's his turn. He also doesn't make eye contact much. Is he just shy or does he not like me?

title: How do you deal with a gas station attendant who won't make eye contact?
self_text: I had to go to the gas station today and there was an attendant working who wouldn't look me in the eyes at all when he took my money. It felt really awkward. Like, what am I supposed to say or do in that situation?  Is it considered rude for someone to not make eye contact when dealing with customers? Is it possible he has social anxiety? Do you think they are on drugs?

title: Is there an alternative to Facebook that is less privacy invasive?
self_text: I'm tired of the tracking and data collection on Facebook, but it's still where all my friends are. Are there any alternatives that respect user privacy more without sacrificing functionality?

title: What is the best way to tell if someone is a narcissist?
self_text: Is it always obvious or can they be very subtle? I feel like there's someone in my life that might be, but I don't know for sure.  They are constantly talking about themselves and how great they are at things, which I thought was just being confident. But then they started subtly putting me down whenever I tried to talk about something I was proud of, so now I'm not sure.   Any advice would be appreciated!

title: Is it just me or is the new Reddit app layout terrible?
self_text: The whole UI feels clunky and unintuitive, especially when compared to Apollo. It's like they took everything that was good about the old design and threw it away in favor of something worse. I also don't understand why they removed so many features, like being able to see all comments at once. And the ads are everywhere! It's really frustrating trying to browse Reddit now. Anyone else feel this way?

title: How does the new iPhone’s camera work?
self_text: I’m not a techie and don’t understand any of these terms, but it seems like the iPhone takes great photos in dark situations with no flash  I've read about computational photography, but that doesn't really help me to visualize what’s happening.

title: Why is it so hard to be happy?
self_text: I have everything that I need, but still can't seem to feel any joy or happiness.  I find myself constantly complaining about things and getting annoyed with people. Is there something wrong with me?

title: Why is the word “bitch” used in songs?
self_text: I've noticed that a lot of musicians use the word "bitch" in their songs and albums. What is it about this word that makes it so popular among musicians?

title: Why does my computer get so hot?
self_text: It's just been idling for like 10 minutes and it's already at 85 degrees Celsius, I don't know what to do anymore. I tried cleaning the fans and reapplying thermal paste but nothing seems to work.

title: What is the best way to do a long distance relationship?
self_text: I've been in a LDR for about 2 months and it hasnt been too bad, but I can see myself being with her for a long time.  I don't want things to fall apart because of the distance or anything like that. Any advice on how to make it last?

title: Is there a way to tell if someone is an actual bot or just really bad at being human?
self_text: I was chatting with someone online and they said some stuff that made me wonder if it was even a real person behind the screen, but I can't quite put my finger on what made me think that...

title: What is the difference between a good looking person and an attractive person?
self_text: I hear people say someone is “good looking” but not necessarily “attractive”. Are they two different things? If so, what’s the difference?

title: Why do people like the color blue?
self_text: I personally don't care for it, but I see it everywhere and everyone seems to agree that blue is a good color. What makes it so appealing?

title: Why are some people scared of the dark?
self_text: I never have been, and can’t imagine being afraid when there is no light. Is it just something that kids go through?  And if so why do some adults still get scared?   Is there a logical explanation for why someone would be scared of not seeing anything?

title: Why do people not use the snooze button?
self_text: I've never understood it, and don't get me wrong if you have to wake up at a certain time for work/school etc, that's fine! But when there is no need to be anywhere or do anything in particular why not just sleep longer? It's not like your body can actually feel refreshed after waking up from an alarm again.  I know you may say "because of inertia" but honestly you should probably just make sure you go to bed early enough so you're getting the right amount of sleep.  Also yes i understand some people are morning people, which is awesome! But how would someone who isn't naturally a morning person ever become one without going through the process of repeatedly snoozing until they eventually get out of bed.

title: Is it okay to make fun of a friend?
self_text: I'm not asking if you can tease your friends or make jokes, I'm saying if they do something really stupid and you laugh at them after.  They might get upset with me for laughing but I think that's normal.

title: Is there a place where you can buy a bunch of cheap pens?
self_text: I need to write out some papers and don't want to spend much money on pens. Where can I go?

title: What's the difference between a cat and dog person?
self_text: I have both, so I don't really know  I just want to hear what other people think is different about them.

title: Is it possible to be a good person if you don’t believe in God?
self_text: I feel like being “good” is a human construct, but what does that mean if there isn’t a divine creator who set the standards for right and wrong?

title: Is there a way to block out the sun?
self_text: I can't go outside when it's too sunny, but I have no AC.  I am very sensitive to light and heat.  My bedroom is on the south side of my house so it gets the most sunlight.  There are also two windows that face east and west so they get a lot of light as well.  Is there anything I could do to block out the sun?

title: Why is it that people who aren't good at something, always want to give advice about that thing?
self_text: I think its because they want to feel like they know a lot more than others, but that's not the case at all.  I'm talking about when someone who has never been on stage tells an actor how he should act or someone who has never run a marathon tries to tell a runner what kind of shoes he should wear.

title: What does it mean when a woman tells you “I’m not like other girls”?
self_text: I was talking to a girl and she told me that. Does it mean that she has low self esteem? Is it an attempt at flirting? Or is she just trying to make herself stand out from the crowd?

title: Why is the UK a parliamentary democracy?
self_text: I'm trying to understand how democracies work and I was looking at countries with different forms of governments. The US for example has a presidential system, where the executive branch (the president) is separate from the legislature (congress). Whereas in the UK the prime minister comes from the parliament (specifically the House of Commons), so there isn't really that separation. This seems like it would lead to more power being concentrated into fewer hands, and less accountability. Is there a reason why the UK decided to adopt a parliamentary system instead of something similar to the US?

title: How do you know if you are getting scammed?
self_text: I’ve been speaking to a guy online for about two months, and he lives in Africa. He wants me to send him money because he says his mother is sick and needs help with medical expenses. What should I do?

title: What is the most important thing a person can do in their life?
self_text: I have been thinking about what the meaning of life is, and it seems to me that no matter how much you accomplish, eventually everyone dies. So does any of it really matter?  I think maybe if you had a kid, then they would carry on your legacy but even that feels pointless. Maybe helping others? But there's so many people who need help, you could spend an entire lifetime just helping people and still not make a dent. It all seems meaningless when you think about it long enough.

title: Is it normal to be attracted to a girl with acne?
self_text: I've been talking to this girl for about two months now and we're starting to get close. She has pretty bad acne, but honestly it doesn't bother me. It's kinda cute in a weird way. But I'm worried that if things go further she might not want to be intimate because of her skin condition. Should I ask her about it or just wait until she brings it up?  I'm really confused right now.

title: What is the most efficient way to use a phone charger?
self_text: I just got a new car, and my old charger doesn't work with it.  I am not sure why it doesn't work, but I need to get a new charger soon so that I can charge my phone while driving.

title: Can you be a lawyer in another state without going to law school there?
self_text: I'm asking because it would save me money if I could go to law school here and then take the bar exam somewhere else.

title: Why do people get so mad at others for not being as into a hobby or activity that they are?
self_text: I'm a big fan of books and I really like to talk about them, but it's always frustrating when someone doesn't know anything about the book or isn't interested in reading it. It makes me feel bad because then I can't share my passion with anyone. Is there a reason why people react like this? Like, if you enjoy something and try to share it with others, why would you get upset if they don't reciprocate?  I think it comes down to validation, maybe. You want other people to appreciate your interests, and it feels bad when they don't. But is there another reason?

title: Why does it seem like the internet has gotten worse?
self_text: I can't explain it, but the internet just seems to have gotten worse in recent years. Like I used to be able to find whatever I was looking for on Google within a few clicks, and now it takes me forever to sift through tons of useless results. And it feels like there are more ads everywhere too, even on websites that don't normally show them. It's just not as fun or easy to use as it once was. Is anyone else experiencing this?

title: Can you get a tattoo in the army?
self_text: I've heard that they don't allow tattoos on your neck, wrist or hands but can you still get them on other parts of your body while enlisted?

title: Is it a weird thing to want to wear socks in bed?
self_text: I'm wondering because my mom says it is, and that it means you have something wrong with your body temperature control. But I just like wearing socks at night.  I was born in November so maybe it's a fall baby thing or something?

title: If you were an astronaut, would you be more upset if your mission was cancelled due to a mechanical failure or because of the political climate?
self_text: What’s worse? Having your trip ruined by something out of your control (mechanical failure) or having it ruined by people on Earth being at odds with each other?  What about the people who have been training for years?

title: Is it bad to use someone else’s phone charger?
self_text: I was over a friend’s house and I noticed they had the same kind of iPhone charger as me, so I asked if I could use theirs since mine broke.  Is there any harm in using another person’s charger? Like can you get viruses or something from doing that? Or does it matter who it comes from?

title: How do people who have no friends/family spend Christmas?
self_text: I'm very lucky to have a big family and lots of close friends so I've never had to worry about spending the holidays alone. But I know there are people out there that don't have anyone, and I can't imagine how lonely that must be. Do they just stay home? Volunteer somewhere? Or is it more common for them to travel somewhere in order to not be alone on such an important day?

title: What are the benefits of a college education?
self_text: I'm looking for a reason to go back to school, but am not sure if it's worth it.  I currently have a job that pays me enough money to live on, and is relatively stress free.  What can I expect from going back to school?

title: Why do people hate that a person who is the same gender as them dates someone of the opposite gender?
self_text: I don’t understand why it matters to some people what gender their friend or family member dates. If they are happy, then what does it matter to you? Is there something about dating outside your own gender that people just hate?  I have never understood this and would like an explanation.

title: What does it mean to have a “good” head?
self_text: I heard someone say that they had a good head on their shoulders and I was wondering what it means in the context of being intelligent.

title: Do people who are very tall get a lot of back pain?
self_text: I’m 5’10” and my back hurts sometimes, but I can only imagine how bad it must be if you were over 6ft.

title: Why do people who are very rich sometimes seem unhappy?
self_text: I know that money doesn’t buy happiness but it seems like a lot of people who have plenty of it still aren’t happy.  I think it is because they don’t experience the same satisfaction from things as we do, so there isn’t much to be excited about.   Is that true?

title: Why do people like pineapple on pizza?
self_text: I've never had it but I don't understand how anyone can enjoy that combination. It just doesn't sound good to me. Is there a certain way you have to eat it for it to be good?

title: Why is there no equivalent to the "Blue Screen of Death" for Android?
self_text: I've never seen an android phone crash like a Windows PC, and it just doesn't make sense to me. What are the technical reasons why this is the case?  If you can explain it in layman terms that would be great!

title: Is it okay to get rid of the packaging from something you bought if your parents ask why?
self_text: I just got a new phone and I was getting rid of all the stuff that came with it when my mom asked what I was doing, so I said “getting rid of the trash” but she told me not to because they might want to return it or something, so now I’m worried about throwing it away.  What do I say to her? Or is it wrong to throw it away even though I don’t need it anymore?

title: Is there a way to avoid having to type the same thing repeatedly?
self_text: Like, when I'm on a dating app and they ask me what my favorite color is, do I have to write it every time? Or is there something I can copy and paste?

title: What’s the biggest difference between being a vegan and being vegetarian?
self_text: Is it just eating eggs or dairy, or is there more to it than that?

title: How can I get rid of a bad smell in my car?
self_text: There's been some coffee spilled on the passenger seat and now it smells like old coffee, even after I cleaned up the spill. Is there any way to remove the smell completely without replacing the seat?

title: Why does my tongue sometimes get really sensitive and almost burn?
self_text: It’s like when I eat something cold, or if I touch it with a toothpick. Is that normal?  I don't think it is but idk what causes it.

title: Why do we get the need to poop after drinking coffee?
self_text: Is it because of caffeine? Or is it something else? I'm just curious.

title: Why do people get mad at other people for not liking a movie?
self_text: I don't understand why some people get so mad when someone doesn't like their favorite movie. It's just a movie, it's okay to have different opinions.  Is this something you think that stems from being raised in an environment where they weren't allowed to have different opinions or something else?
